text: ForwardDiff does not use ChainRules right?

elements.text: ForwardDiff does not use ChainRules right?
Correct.

text: So to use custom rules I'd have to use `DiffRules`?

elements.text: So to use custom rules I'd have to use
DiffRules
Indeed

text: But, tbh, `ForwardDiff` tends to need fewer custom rules than reverse-mode frameworks — have you got a particular example?

elements.text: But, tbh,
ForwardDiff
tends to need fewer custom rules than reverse-mode frameworks — have you got a particular example?

text: Well I am hitting  `NaN` using the `Euclidean` distance for `x==y` , and it would be preferable to return 0 in  this case

elements.text: Well I am hitting
NaN
using the
Euclidean
distance for
x==y
, and it would be preferable to return 0 in  this case

text:
They would be solved by implementing:
```
function euclidean(x, y) 
x == y & & return zero(x+y) 
#code
```

elements.text:
They would be solved by implementing:
```
function euclidean(x, y) 
x == y & & return zero(x+y) 
#code
```

text: Well that would mean some type piracy :sweat_smile:

elements.text: Well that would mean some type piracy

text: Out of curiosity, ForwardDiff not using ChainRules is because it is too complicated/impossible or because it has not been done yet?

elements.text: Out of curiosity, ForwardDiff not using ChainRules is because it is too complicated/impossible or because it has not been done yet?

text: it might be too much work, ForwardDiff is really old and not much of a moving target. Maintenance mode might be incorrect, but close

elements.text: it might be too much work, ForwardDiff is really old and not much of a moving target. Maintenance mode might be incorrect, but close

text: Ah now I see the goto solution is ForwardDiff2

elements.text: Ah now I see the goto solution is ForwardDiff2
The tangent challenger

text: But ForwardDiff2 is on hiatus right now. It's only compatible with old versions of ChainRules and is not actively maintained for the moment.

elements.text: But ForwardDiff2 is on hiatus right now. It's only compatible with old versions of ChainRules and is not actively maintained for the moment.

text: It would be really great if someone could take a stab a making a ChainRules-compliant version of the forward diff that’s buried inside Zygote…

elements.text: It would be really great if someone could take a stab a making a ChainRules-compliant version of the forward diff that’s buried inside Zygote…

text: This would be fantastic. And we could build the ruleset fairly quickly. But right now we're just stuck until someone does that.
